en: Traffic stops are how most people encounter police. This data shows who gets stopped, why, and what happens next—revealing disparities across Missouri's departments.
es: Las paradas de tráfico son cómo la mayoría de la gente encuentra a la policía. Estos datos muestran a quién paran, por qué, y qué pasa después—revelando disparidades entre los departamentos de Missouri.

en: Missouri requires police to report data on every traffic stop: who got stopped, why, what happened, and whether the car was searched. We've compiled that data from every department in the state.
es: Missouri requiere que la policía reporte datos de cada parada de tráfico: a quién pararon, por qué, qué pasó, y si registraron el carro. Compilamos esos datos de cada departamento del estado.

en: We got the raw data from the Missouri Attorney General and individual departments through public records requests. Then we cleaned it, standardized it, and made it searchable.
es: Obtuvimos los datos del Fiscal General de Missouri y de departamentos individuales mediante solicitudes de registros públicos. Luego los limpiamos, estandarizamos y los hicimos buscables.

en: Search any agency to see their full record. Click metrics to compare against statewide numbers. Download the whole dataset if you want to dig deeper.
es: Busca cualquier agencia para ver su registro completo. Haz clic en las métricas para comparar con los números estatales. Descarga todo el conjunto de datos si quieres profundizar más.

en: Missouri cops made 1.5 million traffic stops in 2023. This data shows who gets stopped, why, and what happens next—revealing disparities across departments.
Some departments search vehicles 5 times more often than others. Search rates and outcomes differ dramatically depending on location and department policies.
Citations are issued in less than half of all traffic stops statewide. The majority of stops result in warnings rather than tickets or arrests.
From small town police to county sheriffs, every law enforcement agency in Missouri reports stop data. This represents the most comprehensive view of traffic enforcement in the state.
This is an independent data journalism project analyzing Missouri traffic stop records. We believe transparency in policing data helps communities understand and improve public safety.
Love our work? Hire us for your next data project.
